intro: Anomospermum chloranthum subsp. chloranthum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered ghost tree, is a small shrub native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, yellowish-green leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. This species is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
